intro: Henckelia corrugata, commonly known as the wrinkled heath, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces delicate white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
